column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of 6H-B Ba3NiSb2O9 were synthesized by treatment under HPHT of 6H-A Ba3NiSb2O9.
#Text=The ambient pressure 6H-A form was prepared by a conventional solid-state reaction.
#Text=First NiSb2O6 was prepared by reaction of NiO (Strem, 99.99%) and Sb2O5 (Alfa, 99.998 %) in air at 1000 °C.
#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of BaCO3 (Aldrich, 99.98 %) and NiSb2O6 were then heated at 1000°C for 68 h and 1200 °C for 70h in air with an intermediate regrinding [14].
#Text=Samples of the 6H-A phase were characterized by powder Xray diffraction (XRPD) on a Bruker D8 Advance instrument using monochromatic Cu-K α1 (λ= 1.540598 Å) radiation.
#Text=Pure samples of 6H-A Ba3NiSb2O9 were then packed into gold capsules and heated in either a belt or a Conac 28 anvil-type apparatus.
#Text=The latter device allows elaborating a larger amount of powder ( 350mg) in a single experiment.
#Text=Several syntheses were performed with the belt anvil system in order to determine the best conditions for the syntheses.
#Text=The explored condition range was between 2 and 4 GPa and 400°C to 680°C.
#Text=The resulting phases were characterized by XRPD analysis.
